key_title: Key to the species of Amphibromus

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lemmas with at least the inner pair of apical teeth ending in a bristle 2–4 mm long
Apical teeth of lemma not bristle-tipped
Plants usually stoloniferous; awns straight or gently curved
Plants tufted; awns with a strong bend at or below midway
Lowest lemma in spikelet less than 6 mm long; spikelets (excluding awns) (6–)9–15 mm long; florets up to 10 per spikelet
Lowest lemma in spikelet more than 6 mm long; spikelets (excluding awns) 12–21 mm long; florets up to 7 per spikelet
Lemma densely hispid, the 4 apical teeth more or less equal; awn scarcely twisted; lemma mostly less than 5 mm long; spikelet mostly less than 10 mm long

Lemma scabrous or papillose, apical teeth 2 or 4, if 4 then the outer pair usually poorly developed; awn twisted near base; lemma mostly more than 5 mm long (occasionally shorter in A. neesii); spikelet more than 10 mm long
Ligule less than 5 mm long; lemma swollen in lower half
Ligule more than 6 mm long (rarely as short as 4.5 mm in A. neesii); lemma not obviously swollen
Awn inserted in the upper one-third of lemma which is rather abruptly tapered above the point of insertion
Awn inserted in middle one-third of lemma which is not abruptly tapered above the point of insertion
Apex of lemma elongate, papery, (2–) 4-toothed; lemma strongly scabrous on back in lower half; awn inserted at or below midway on lemma (50–60% of the total lemma length from apex)

Apex of lemma evenly tapered from widest part, 2-toothed (sometimes with an outer pair of much reduced teeth); lemma smooth to scabrous on back in lower half; awn inserted at or slightly above midway (40–55% of lemma length from apex)
